case_title: (Auqaf and Settlement), Board of Revenue DARHOON vs AULADI AND ANOTHER
appellant: (Auqaf and Settlement), Board of Revenue DARHOON
complaint_summary: The Additional Commissioner, Hyderabad Division, canceled a five-year lease of the petitioner and reserved the land for village assaish of Urs Machi.
investigation_summary: The Assistant Commissioner, Shandadpur, submitted a report confirming that the entire area of S. No. 289/2, 3, and 4 (10-10 acres) falls within 20 chains of the village Urs Machi.

judgment_summary.appeal_against: Order of Additional Commissioner, Hyderabad Division dated 18-10-1981
judgment_summary.lease_status: Five years lease of petitioner cancelled
judgment_summary.main_contentions_petitioner: The petitioner argued that the entire area does not fall within 20 chains of the village Urs Machi and that the policy reserves only land within 20 chains for village assaish. The petitioner was unable to substantiate claims with documentary proof.
judgment_summary.main_contentions_respondent: The respondent argued that the entire grant of the petitioner falls within 20 chains of the village Urs Machi, justifying the Additional Commissioner’s decision.
judgment_summary.assistant_commissioner_report: The Assistant Commissioner reported that the entire S. No. 289/2, 3, and 4 area of 10-10 acres falls within 20 chains of the village Urs Machi; no other land was available for the petitioner.
judgment_summary.decision: No reason to interfere with the order of Additional Commissioner, Hyderabad.

legal_arguments: The petitioner argued that the entire area does not fall within 20 chains of the village Urs Machi and that the policy reserves only land within 20 chains for village assaish.
The respondent argued that the entire grant of the petitioner falls within 20 chains of the village, justifying the Additional Commissioner’s decision.
assets: Land (10-10 acres) in S. No. 289/2, 3, and 4

land_details.location: Within 20 chains of village Urs Machi

statutes: Policy on land reservation for village assaish
key_issues: Whether the land falls within 20 chains of the village Urs Machi.
Whether the Additional Commissioner’s order aligns with the policy on land reservation.

legal_terms.assaish: Land reserved for the use or benefit of a village.

words_and_phrases.20 chains: A measurement of distance used in land demarcation.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the cancellation of a lease and reservation of land for village assaish. The petitioner failed to provide documentary proof to support their claim that the land does not fall within the reserved area. The court upheld the Additional Commissioner’s decision based on the Assistant Commissioner’s report.
